title: Executive functional deficits during electrical stimulation of the right frontal aslant tract
patient: Patient is a right-handed 42-year-old male that presented with a seizure. An MRI-scan revealed an intra-axial non-enhancing lesion in the right prefrontal lobe, typical for a low-grade glioma. The patient had no relevant medical history and upon neurological examination no abnormalities were found. His education level was intermediate vocational. He stated that he was doing well psychosocially, and he and his wife had not noticed any major changes in their personal life. Patient functioned adequately as a husband, as father of two small children, and as chief of his own small company.
